etymology.description: 华(華) (huá, "China; magnificent") + 侨(僑) (qiáo, "to live abroad")
etymology.interpretation: 华侨(華僑) (huáqiáo) means 'overseas Chinese.' The word combines 华(華) (huá), representing 'China' and symbolizing magnificence, and 侨(僑) (qiáo), which means 'to live abroad.' This combination reflects Chinese people who establish themselves outside of China while maintaining cultural ties to their homeland.

examples.chinese: 许多华侨在国外投资(許多華僑在國外投資)。
他出生于中国(他出生於中國)，后来成为成功的华侨商人(後來成為成功的華僑商人)。
examples.pinyin: tā chūshēng yú zhōngguó, hòulái chéngwéi chénggōng de huáqiáo shāngrén.
examples.english: He was born in China and later became a successful overseas Chinese businessman.

examples.chinese: 不少华侨热衷于保护中国文化(不少華僑熱衷於保護中國文化)。
examples.pinyin: bùshǎo huáqiáo rèzhōng yú bǎohù zhōngguó wénhuà.
examples.english: Many overseas Chinese are keen on protecting Chinese culture.
